description: Cardiff City are set to be without first choice goalkeeper Ryan Allsop for the first three games of the new Championship season.
title: Cardiff City goalkeeper Ryan Allsop set to miss first three Championship games
title_page: Cardiff City goalkeeper Ryan Allsop set to miss first three Championship games - BBC Sport
maintext:
Cardiff City are set to be without first choice goalkeeper Ryan Allsop for the first three games of the new season.
Allsop came off with a knock in Cardiff's goalless friendly at Wycombe.
The 31-year-old is now likely to miss games against Leeds, Colchester and Queens Park Rangers.
"He got a small injury from our last friendly so he will not be with us. I think 10 days," said Cardiff manager Erol Bulut.
"We have Jak [Alnwick] so he will be good in goal for us and will handle it well".
Allsop is expected to miss the opening Championship games against Leeds United and QPR as well as the EFL Cup tie against Colchester United.
Meanwhile Bulut could make further squad additions having signed midfielder Josh Bowler on loan from Nottingham Forest, alongside Aaron Ramsey, Yakou Meite, Karlan Grant, Ike Ugbo and Dimitrios Goutas.
